Line 114: Line 114:
From the mid-1970s up to the early 1990s, it was aware of, but took no action to stop, an organised large scale tax evasion scheme organised by [[Ansbacher Bank]] for the benefit of wealthy and powerful Irish people. Included in those who were breaking the law were a director of the Central Bank and the architect given the commission to design their headquarters (in contravention of planning permission).<ref>[http://www.independent.ie/national-news/news-digest-500406.html Revealed: Central Bank list of secret Ansbacher names - National News, Frontpage - Independent.ie]</ref><ref>[http://www.tax-news.com/news/Irish_Central_Bank_Slammed_For_Failing_To_Act_On_Ansbacher_Suspicions_____8748.html Irish Central Bank Slammed For Failing To Act On Ansbacher Suspicions]</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.scotsman.com/world/Irelands-high-rollers-named-and.2341383.jp | location=Edinburgh | work=The Scotsman | first=Nicola | last=Byrne | title=IrelandÃ¢ÂÂs high rollers named and shamed | date=7 July 2002}}</ref><ref>[http://www.scribd.com/doc/23685167/Ansbacher-Report Ansbacher Report]</ref><ref>O'Toole Fintan,Ship of Fools,Pages 55â72, Faber and Faber Ltd 2010, ISBN 978-0-571-26075-1</ref>
From the mid-1970s up to the early 1990s, it was aware of, but took no action to stop, an organised large scale tax evasion scheme organised by [[Ansbacher Bank]] for the benefit of wealthy and powerful Irish people. Included in those who were breaking the law were a director of the Central Bank and the architect given the commission to design their headquarters (in contravention of planning permission).<ref>[http://www.independent.ie/national-news/news-digest-500406.html Revealed: Central Bank list of secret Ansbacher names - National News, Frontpage - Independent.ie]</ref><ref>[http://www.tax-news.com/news/Irish_Central_Bank_Slammed_For_Failing_To_Act_On_Ansbacher_Suspicions_____8748.html Irish Central Bank Slammed For Failing To Act On Ansbacher Suspicions]</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.scotsman.com/world/Irelands-high-rollers-named-and.2341383.jp | location=Edinburgh | work=The Scotsman | first=Nicola | last=Byrne | title=IrelandÃ¢ÂÂs high rollers named and shamed | date=7 July 2002}}</ref><ref>[http://www.scribd.com/doc/23685167/Ansbacher-Report Ansbacher Report]</ref><ref>O'Toole Fintan,Ship of Fools,Pages 55â72, Faber and Faber Ltd 2010, ISBN 978-0-571-26075-1</ref>
â
[[File:Punt - Series B - Ireland.png|thumb|350px|[[Medb]] the legendary [[Kings of Connacht|Queen of Connacht]]]]
+
[[File:Punt - Series B - Ireland.png|thumb|350px|[[Medb]] the legendary [[Kings of Connacht|Queen of Connacht]] {{deletable image-caption|Wednesday, 29 June 2011}}]]
In 2000 the Dail Public Accounts Committee "DIRT" enquiry, into the facilitation of wide spread tax evasion by the banking industry, was of the view that the Central Bank had an inappropriate and outmoded approach to supervision in the context of the growing sophistication of banking and the changing role of banks. It also found there was an insufficient concern with ethics and supervision other than from the standpoint of a traditional and narrow concern with prudential supervision in the Central Bank.<ref>[http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/opinion/2010/0422/1224268870178.html The Irish Times - Thu, Apr 22, 2010 - Paying a high price for toothless regulation]</ref><ref>[http://www.gov.ie/committees-99/c-publicaccounts/sub-rep/page5.htm DÃ­ospÃ³ireachtaÃ­ CoistÃ­ - Committee Debates]</ref> The Chairman of the inquiry was "shocked and horrified" at the "careless and reckless" manner in which the Governor had quoted false statistics to the Public Accounts subcommittee.<ref>[http://www.independent.ie/national-news/heads-must-roll-says-jim-mitchell-521833.html Heads must roll, says Jim Mitchell - National News, Frontpage - Independent.ie]</ref>
In 2000 the Dail Public Accounts Committee "DIRT" enquiry, into the facilitation of wide spread tax evasion by the banking industry, was of the view that the Central Bank had an inappropriate and outmoded approach to supervision in the context of the growing sophistication of banking and the changing role of banks. It also found there was an insufficient concern with ethics and supervision other than from the standpoint of a traditional and narrow concern with prudential supervision in the Central Bank.<ref>[http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/opinion/2010/0422/1224268870178.html The Irish Times - Thu, Apr 22, 2010 - Paying a high price for toothless regulation]</ref><ref>[http://www.gov.ie/committees-99/c-publicaccounts/sub-rep/page5.htm DÃ­ospÃ³ireachtaÃ­ CoistÃ­ - Committee Debates]</ref> The Chairman of the inquiry was "shocked and horrified" at the "careless and reckless" manner in which the Governor had quoted false statistics to the Public Accounts subcommittee.<ref>[http://www.independent.ie/national-news/heads-must-roll-says-jim-mitchell-521833.html Heads must roll, says Jim Mitchell - National News, Frontpage - Independent.ie]</ref>
